title: Hunter Gets a Bagel
sub_head: Will media cover foreign influence sales as extensively as breakfast purchases?
body:
It’s no surprise that the American press corps is falling hard for the Biden presidency. This week’s coverage suggests that public displays of media affection are likely to continue, no matter how uncomfortable they make news consumers feel.
Last week’s coverage inspired Politico’s Jack Shafer to urge industry colleagues to embrace professional sobriety. Mr. Shafer described inauguration reportage:
A tad less bootlicking sounds like a sensible idea, but are media folk ready to embrace Mr. Shafer’s message?
This morning CNN’s Kate Bennett reports:
It remains unclear why CNN needs to shield the identity of White House staff complimenting the Bidens, but perhaps sources were unwilling to have their names associated with such coverage.
